summary: The study was published at the University of Mississippi Medical Center, Jackson, MS 39216, USA . The study is published on March 28, 2015 .

The native PpFucCS exhibited potent inhibitory activity against HCMV specifically blocking virus entry into the cell . The inhibitory activities of the LMW PpfucCS derivatives were proportional to their chain lengths . PpPFuccs and the derived oligosaccharides did not exhibit any significant cytotoxicity .

PpFucCS was used to target HS–virus interaction and prevent HCMV entry into cells . We show that PpfucCS has significant antiviral activity against H CMV and that, when hydrolyzed into fractions, the oligosaccharides lose their anti-HCMV activity in a size-dependent manner . HFFs were infected with HCMV at a multiplicity of infection (MOI) of 0.1.1 . Cells were fixed at 5 days post-infection (dpi) and the number of GFP-positive cells for each concentration was enumerated using the Cytation 5 automated microscope .

HFFs were pretreated for 1 h with a range of concentrations of PpFucCS and mock (in duplicates of two independent experiments) and infected with HCMV at a MOI of 3.5 p/mL . HFF cells were immediately stained using Modified Giemsa stain (Sigma-Aldrich, Milli-pore Sigma, Burlington

HFF cells were grown on coverslip inserts in 24-well tissue culture plates . They were then infected with R18-labeled HCMV at a MOI of 3.0 or mock infected . ucCS oligosaccharides were assayed for their potential to inhibit the HCMV (GFP-tagged TowneBAC strain) infection in HFFs (MOI 0.1) by enumerating cells expressing GFP . Normalized values from the assay were analyzed by nonlinear regression to fit a dose–response curve .

PpFucCS and its oligosaccharides do not exhibit any significant cytotoxicity against primary HFF cells when examined at the highest concentration used in the antiviral assay (50 μg/mL) and show a protective effect against virus-induced cell death at five days post infection .

The Fr3 and Fr4 that did not show any significant antiviral activity did not protect against virus-induced cell death . We treated the HFFs with the native PpFucCS at 500 μg/mL and 50 μg/L for five days . Viruses or other pathogens utilize this structural diversity of GAG to selectively bind and enter the cells .
